name: Seattle Indian Health Board - Elders Program
description: Provides a community space for American Indian and Alaska Native Elders (55+) to socialize and stay connected. Offers health education, resource information, and referrals to traditional medicine
services: American-Indian-owned Companionship care in Washington consultation

name: Hummingbird Indigenous Family Services
address: (Specific address not readily available, but serves the greater Seattle/King County area)
description: Offers free perinatal services and supportive networks from pregnancy up to a child's second birthday. They also have programs that support Indigenous families and may connect to broader community care resources
services: American-Indian-owned Companionship care in Washington consultation

name: Washington Tribal Assistance Resource Center (part of DSHS Aging and Long-Term Support Administration)
description: ALTSA partners with tribes to support elders and adults with disabilities in remaining independent at home. They coordinate services to meet health, social, and personal care needs
services: American-Indian-owned Companionship care in Washington consultation

name: Yakama Nation Area Agency on Aging
description: Develops a community that promotes independence and choice for seniors and adults with disabilities. Offers case management, nursing services, and a family caregiver support program
services: American-Indian-owned Companionship care in Washington consultation

name: Lifespan Respite Washington
description: This program works to increase respite options for American Indian and Alaskan Native caregivers and is open to eligible caregivers. They can provide information on finding respite care
services: American-Indian-owned Companionship care in Washington consultation

name: American Indian Community Center (AICC)
address: (Specific address not readily available, but serves the Spokane area)
description: Provides social and economic development services, including family services and senior lunches, for the Spokane area
services: American-Indian-owned Companionship care in Washington consultation

name: Native Resource Hub (part of VOAWW)
phone: Call 988 and dial option 4, or text N8V to 988
description: A statewide resource line for Native American/Alaska Native people seeking culturally appropriate behavioral health resources. They can coordinate care and provide Native American-specific resources
services: American-Indian-owned Companionship care in Washington consultation

name: NWRC Tribal Outreach & Assistance Program
description: Links American Indian Elders with services, providing information and assistance in finding culturally appropriate care, personal care, and other home assistance
services: American-Indian-owned Companionship care in Washington consultation

name: Sanrise Homecare LLC
description: Offers companion care services focused on connection, trust, and dignity, providing meaningful social interaction and practical support. While not explicitly stated as Native-owned, they serve diverse communities and offer personalized care
services: American-Indian-owned Companionship care in Washington consultation

name: Family Resource Home Care (formerly Beneficial In-Home Care, Inc.)
description: Provides in-home care services, including companion care, for residents of all ages and special needs. They emphasize being locally owned and operated. While not explicitly stated as Native-owned, they have a long history in Washington and serve diverse communities
